Module lanat
Package lanat.utils

Interface ErrorsContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of error level provider
All Known Implementing Classes:
Argument, ArgumentParser, ArgumentType, BooleanArgumentType, ByteArgumentType, Command, CounterArgumentType, DoubleArgumentType, DummyArgumentType, EnumArgumentType, ErrorsContainerImpl, FileArgumentType, FloatArgumentType, FromParseableArgumentType, IntegerArgumentType, KeyValuesArgumentType, LongArgumentType, MultipleStringsArgumentType, NumberArgumentType, NumberRangeArgumentType, Parser, ParsingStateBase, ShortArgumentType, StdinArgumentType, StringArgumentType, Tokenizer, TryParseArgumentType, TupleArgumentType
public interface ErrorsContainer<T extends ErrorLevelProvider>
Represents a container of errors. Methods are provided to get the errors under a certain level, and to check if there are errors under a certain level.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    @NotNull List<@NotNull T>
    getErrorsUnderDisplayLevel()
    Returns a list of all the errors under the display level defined in this error container.
    @NotNull List<@NotNull T>
    getErrorsUnderExitLevel()
    Returns a list of all the errors under the exit level defined in this error container.
    @NotNull ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel>
    getMinimumDisplayErrorLevel()
    Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to be displayed to the user.
    @NotNull ModifyRecord<@NotNull ErrorLevel>
    getMinimumExitErrorLevel()
    Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.
    boolean
    hasDisplayErrors()
    Returns true if there are errors under the display level defined in this error container.
    boolean
    hasExitErrors()
    Returns true if there are errors under the exit level defined in this error container.
    void
    setMinimumDisplayErrorLevel(@NotNull ErrorLevel level)
    Sets the minimum level that errors should have in order to be displayed to the user.
    void
    setMinimumExitErrorLevel(@NotNull ErrorLevel level)
    Sets the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.

  • Method Details

    • getErrorsUnderExitLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderExitLevel()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the exit level defined in this error container. These are errors that would cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the exit level

    • getErrorsUnderDisplayLevel

      @NotNull @NotNull List<@NotNull T> getErrorsUnderDisplayLevel()
      Returns a list of all the errors under the display level defined in this error container. These are errors that would be displayed to the user.
      Returns:
      a list of all the errors under the display level

    • hasExitErrors

      boolean hasExitErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the exit level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are exit errors

    • hasDisplayErrors

      boolean hasDisplayErrors()
      Returns true if there are errors under the display level defined in this error container.
      Returns:
      true if there are display errors

    • setMinimumExitErrorLevel

      void setMinimumExitErrorLevel(@NotNull @NotNull ErrorLevel level)
      Sets the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.
      Parameters:
      level - the minimum exit error level

      Returns the minimum level that errors should have in order to cause the program to exit.
      Returns:
      the minimum exit error level
